text:
Simon Gregson reveals his wife suffered 11 miscarriages as trolls abuse Emma over Coronation Street stillbirth storyline The soap star's character Steve and wife Michelle will lose their baby in heartbreaking scenes this week Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Simon Gregson has revealed his wife Emma has suffered 11 heartbreaking miscarriages in response to vile trolls criticising his Coronation Street storyline. 
The soap star's character Steve and on-screen wife Michelle will lose their baby this week in devastating scenes , and many fans were unaware just how close to home the story has hit. 
Making the revelation on Twitter, he wrote: "To the £&)(; who tweeted my wife. We've lost 11 baby's 1st being 21 weeks 4 days. Maybe think or do your research before tweeting someone (sic)" 
Simon and Emma got married in 2010, and have three boys - Alfie, nine, Harry, seven and one-year-old Teddy - together. 
They previously revealed they lose Teddy's twin early in the pregnancy, with the star's wife telling OK! magazine: "Sadly only one of the twins survived. We’re very lucky to have this one. Simon seen with wife Emma and sons Alfie and Harry (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
“There’s no reason or explanation for it. It was just one of those things. I was a little disheartened. We just thought that everything happens for a reason.” Read More
